reviews.text: Everything was so great and delicious. The people are nice. Three sisters as third generation manage the restaurant and they are really lovely. This is a real traditional Valencian restaurant. We tried the Marisco paella and mascarpone crisp with prawn were really delicious.

Nice little restaurant, friendly service and accommodated even though I didn't have a reservation. Like many reviews stated, the sangria was nicely presented and tasted lovely. Ordered the ham/cheese coquette - these were rather oily even though the filling inside was sufficient and creamy, very coying because of the amount of oil.

They are famous for their paella, however I found the rice undercooked (you can see the white bits in the middle) and extremely salty. At 24 euros per serving, would probably find better elsewhere. On the positive, the seafood was plentiful and fresh. Naturally sweet and tasty.

This place was amazing! Wonderful service and the best paella. It was recommended by a local and we reserved in advance (there was a line up at the door). The mussels were in season and melted in your mouth along with the squid paella which was perfection, tender and delicious. Also can we talk about the sangria?! I mean I didn’t go for the sangria but I’m so glad I ordered it! Women owned business that was phenomenal. Reserve it, go, and enjoy the smartest decision you’ll make!

A delightful, delicious comida. We  had a wonderful lunch here. The staff was so friendly and they made room for us without a reservation. Grilled squid and Valencian tomato salad were gorgeous. The vegetable paella was so yummy. Only problem was we had no room for dessert! Arrive hungry. I hope to return next time I'm in Valencia.
Great food, colorful with amazing taste. We were pleasantly surprised with quality of food. I will share this place with anyone who comes to Valencia. Thank you for a nice experience
